lead_paragraph: Financial markets have been "very unfair" to Portugal, failing to recognize its previous deficit-cutting achievements and pressing the country to adopt more stringent economic measures than the government wanted, Prime Minister José Sócrates said Thursday, Raphael Minder writes in The New York Times.
snippet: Financial markets have been "very unfair" to Portugal, failing to recognize its previous deficit-cutting achievements and pressing the country to adopt more stringent economic measures than the government wanted, Prime Minister José Sócrates said...

headline.main: Portugal's Leader Moves to Satisfy 'Unfair' Markets

abstract: Financial markets have been "very unfair" to Portugal, failing to recognize its previous deficit-cutting achievements and pressing the country to adopt more stringent economic measures than the government wanted, Prime Minister José Sócrates said Thursday.
